intro: Languas copelandii, commonly known as the Cape honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its vibrant orange to red tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Languas copelandii thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental plant in gardens.
